intro: Dicliptera welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance through its fibrous root system. Dicliptera welwitschii is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks, contributing to soil stabilization and ecological diversity.
